info.official_title: Clinical Utility of a Non Endoscopic Device EsoCheck and Biomarker EsoGuard as Alternative to Endoscopy for Screening for Barrett's Esophagus in At Risk Population (ASBE) A Randomized Controlled, Virtual Patient Trial

inclusion_lines.line: 1. Board-certified physicians whose scope of practice includes preventative care and disease screening, and/or those whose scope of practice include diagnosis and management of esophageal disease (examples include but are not limited to primary care physicians/ general practitioners, family medicine physicians, gastroenterologists, and foregut surgeons);

criterions.exact_snippets: scope of practice includes preventative care and disease screening
criterions.criterion: scope of practice: preventative care and disease screening

requirements.expected_value: includes preventative care and disease screening

criterions.exact_snippets: scope of practice include diagnosis and management of esophageal disease
criterions.criterion: scope of practice: diagnosis and management of esophageal disease

requirements.expected_value: includes diagnosis and management of esophageal disease

inclusion_lines.line: 3. Have an active panel (whether as part of a group practice, or individually) of over 1000 patients with an adult patient load of more than 50%.

criterions.exact_snippets: Have an active panel (whether as part of a group practice, or individually) of over 1000 patients
adult patient load of more than 50%

inclusion_lines.line: 2. Have between 1 to 40 years of post-residency clinical experience within their field of practice;

criterions.exact_snippets: Have between 1 to 40 years of post-residency clinical experience within their field of practice
